news.title: Delhi HC junks plea to monitor ED probe against IREO Residences
news.para: The Delhi High Court has greenlit the Enforcement Directorate's (ED) investigation into real estate firm IREO Residences, dismissing allegations of bias. Justice Manmeet Pritam Singh Arora reprimanded petitioner Gulshan Babbar for withholding crucial information and imposed a ₹1.25 lakh penalty for misleading the court.

news.title: Goa CM urges centre to relax sand extraction, sound rules
news.para: Chief Minister Pramod Sawant has requested the Union government to ease sand extraction regulations, similar to those in Andaman and Nicobar Islands, and consider allowing music beyond the 10 PM restriction to boost tourism in Goa.

news.title: Pune: Residents express concern over neglect of dilapidated buildings in Camp
news.para: Camp residents are deeply concerned about the deteriorating buildings in their area, criticizing the Pune Cantonment Board (PCB) for inaction. Despite a 2021 survey identifying over 100 dangerous properties, many structures remain hazardous. Disputes between owners and tenants, particularly regarding low rents, hinder redevelopment efforts.

news.title: Reviewing CCI order, will take appropriate legal recourse: Asian Paints
news.para: Asian Paints faces a CCI investigation for allegedly abusing its dominant market position following a complaint by Grasim Industries, which recently entered the paint sector with Birla Opus. The CCI suspects Asian Paints of exclusionary practices, potentially violating competition laws by restricting dealers from working with Grasim.

news.title: Yashwant Singh buys bungalow in South Delhi for ₹100 crore
news.para: Yashwant Singh, a member of Rajasthan's royal family, has acquired an 867-square-metre bungalow in Delhi's Golf Links for Rs 100 crore. This transaction is part of a trend of high-value property deals in the area, with Golf Links becoming a sought-after location for corporate leaders and HNIs, driving prices up due to limited availability.

news.title: Delhi consumer commission holds DLF Gayatri Developers liable for delay in housing project completion
news.para: The Delhi State Consumer Disputes Redressal Commission has held DLF Gayatri Developers accountable for delaying a housing project in Andhra Pradesh. The commission ordered a refund of Rs 15 lakh, along with Rs 1.5 lakh for mental distress and legal expenses, due to the developer's failure to deliver possession as promised.

news.title: Wayanad township to be ready by December 2025: Kerala revenue minister
news.para: Revenue Minister K Rajan announced that the Elstone Estate township, housing 1,662 Mundakkai–Chooralmala disaster survivors in 410 homes, is slated for completion by December 2025. The government has allocated ₹108 crore for rehabilitation, including land acquisition, compensation, and livelihood support.

news.title: West Bengal government to offer 20 acres in New Town for residential & commercial use
news.para: The Bengal government is set to unlock approximately 20 acres in New Town Action Areas II and III for residential, commercial, and mixed-use developments. HIDCO will allot these land parcels on a freehold basis through e-auction next month, focusing on developing Action Area III, where IT giants are establishing offices.

news.title: Homebuyers in Karnataka seek action on long-pending property issues
news.para: Another significant concern was the lack of a project closure policy under RERA in Karnataka. The forum noted that while developers are mandated to register their projects with RERA, there is no structured mechanism to ensure completion as per the Act’s provisions. They urged the government to introduce a project closure framework to ensure compliance.

news.title: Noida, Greater Noida & YEIDA are 'crown jewels of Uttar Pradesh: Minister
news.para: The minister said promoting industry and investment is "our govt's top priority". "With new units coming up, employment opportunities will increase and Uttar Pradesh will continue its journey to becoming the best-performing state," the minister said after reviewing various projects during his two-day visit to Gautam Budh Nagar.

news.title: Two more FIRs registered against Ansal Group in Lucknow
news.para: The Ansal Group faces mounting legal trouble in Lucknow, with two new FIRs filed at Sushant Golf City police station, bringing the total to 235. These latest complaints involve alleged fraud of ₹13.60 lakh from two individuals promised flats and plots.

news.title: Five districts in Gujarat attract ₹5.03 lakh crore investment in real estate in nine years
news.para: Since 2017, Gujarat's real estate has attracted ₹5.03 lakh crore, but 94% is concentrated in Ahmedabad, Gandhinagar, Surat, Vadodara, and Rajkot. These hubs account for 86% of projects and 89% of housing units, with Ahmedabad leading at ₹2.1 lakh crore.

news.title: UK construction downturn eases as house-building improves, commercial work tanks
news.para: The UK construction industry saw a slight improvement in June. Homebuilding experienced growth. However, commercial building faced a decline. This was due to concerns about the economy. New orders decreased. Business expectations reached their lowest point since December 2022.

news.title: CCI directs UltraTech Cement, Dalmia Bharat to furnish financial records
news.para: Competition Commission of India has instructed UltraTech, Dalmia Bharat Cements, and Shree Digvijay Cements to provide financial records. This follows an investigation that revealed breaches of competition regulations. The directive includes executives submitting financial details.

news.title: Home sales in Toronto rise to five-month high in June
news.para: Toronto's housing market shows signs of recovery. Home sales in the Greater Toronto Area increased for the third month in June. However, home prices continued to fall. More homes are available for buyers. They are negotiating discounts. Lower borrowing costs are making homeownership more accessible. The Bank of Canada has cut interest rates.

news.title: Codename The One: A Signature Offering from Shriram Properties
news.para: Shriram Properties is launching Codename The One along Bangalore's NH 844, a strategic location near Electronic City and future infrastructure projects. This limited collection of 340 homes emphasizes thoughtful design with rooftop walkways, vertical gardens, and resident-exclusive amenities. The location offers proximity to major industries and developing transport corridors, presenting a promising opportunity for early buyers.

news.title: No separate civic body for merged areas by demerging PMC: Maharashtra industries minister
news.para: State Industries Minister Uday Samant announced that there are no immediate plans for a separate municipal corporation for Pune's newly merged areas, as the state government is providing funds for their development. MLC Yogesh Tilekar raised concerns about the strain on PMC's resources due to the merger.

news.title: Brigade Hotel Ventures raises ₹126 crore through pre-IPO placement round
news.para: Brigade Hotel Ventures secured ₹126 crore before its initial public offering. The company issued shares to 360 ONE Alternates Asset Management. This pre-IPO placement represents a 4.74% stake. The IPO size is now reduced to ₹774 crore.
